item.description:
Greetings everyone! The first day of Spring is this Saturday, and as of today the weather looks pretty good! Lets hit the scenic roads of Concord & Carlisle, for a 20 mile route of rolling hills and picturesque views. We'll aim for an average of 12-15 MPH, nothing too intense for this early in the season.

We'll meetup at Monument Square at 10:15, we'll say hello, I'll pass out cue sheets, and we'll hit the road no later than 10:30. We'll aim to be back to the starting place around lunchtime and anyone who wants to stick around and join me for a bite to eat at Main Streets Cafe is more than welcome.

Link to Meetup Spot

Link to Route Map

If you have NOT been out riding at all this year, please make sure your bike is tuned up and ready to ride... we want to avoid hardware malfunctions if possible. I recommend a road bike for this ride, but if you can keep that pace on a different style bike, then hey, that'll work!

If you are driving to the meetup spot, you can find street parking on many of the streets near monument square. In the past, I have done very well finding spots on Lexington Road, across from the church.

See you there!
- Jon
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be the guy handing out cue sheets
item.name: 20 Mile Ride: Concord & Carlisle
